com.yantra.yfs.japi

Class YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Return value for collectionCreditCard, collectionCustomerAccount, collectionDebitCard and collectionOthers user exits.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • authorizationAmount

        public double authorizationAmount
        Both the charged and authorized amount are returned here. Stored in yfs_credit_card_transaction table.

      • authorizationId

        public java.lang.String authorizationId
        Sets the Authorization ID. Returning an authorizationId in this field will set the authorizationId if it was previously empty. Returning a different id will replace the current authorizationId for CHARGE records, but only if the proper reauthorization information is returned using recordAdditionalTransactions. See recordAdditionalTransactions. Varchar2(255)

      • authorizationExpirationDate

        public java.lang.String authorizationExpirationDate
        Expiration date for authorization. Date format is: YYYYMMDDHHMISS (HH is a 24 hour format)

      • tranType

        public java.lang.String tranType
        Transaction type. Varchar2(40)

      • tranAmount

        public double tranAmount
        Transaction amount.

      • bPreviousInvocationSuccessful

        public boolean bPreviousInvocationSuccessful
        Flag to denote that the data being returned was actually collected through a previous invocation. If this flag is returned as false and the call was made for a previously invoked charge transaction record, then an attempt will be made to authrize/charge that charge transaction record again

      • tranRequestTime

        public java.lang.String tranRequestTime
        Transaction request time. Stored in yfs_credit_card_transaction table.

      • tranReturnCode

        public java.lang.String tranReturnCode
        Transaction return code. Stored in yfs_credit_card_transaction table.

      • tranReturnMessage

        public java.lang.String tranReturnMessage
        Transaction return message. Stored in yfs_credit_card_transaction table.

        public java.lang.String tranReturnFlag
        Transaction return flag. Stored in yfs_credit_card_transaction table.

        public java.lang.String requestID
        Request ID. Stored in yfs_credit_card_transaction table.

        public java.lang.String internalReturnCode
        Internal return code. Stored in yfs_credit_card_transaction table.

        Internal return flag. Stored in yfs_credit_card_transaction table.

        Card Verification Value authorization code. Stored in yfs_credit_card_transaction table.

      • collectionDate

        public java.util.Date collectionDate
        This can be used to suspend the charge collection till this date. This date is used only if 'retryFlag' is passed as 'Y'.

      • executionDate

        public java.util.Date executionDate
        execution date - this data can indicate when the charge was executed.

      • holdOrderAndRaiseEvent

        public boolean holdOrderAndRaiseEvent
        if order payment status should not be changed to "FAILED_AUTH" or "FAILED_CHARGE", set this to false

      • asynchRequestProcess

        public boolean asynchRequestProcess
        if request is logged and you wish to respond asynchronously, set this to true

      • asyncRequestIdentifier

        public java.lang.String asyncRequestIdentifier
        if request is logged as asynchronous, use asyncRequestIdentifier to pass a unique identifier that can be used for recording the actual response against asynchronously closed transaction, if not passed in the UE output then chargeTransactionKey will be stored as default. Stored in YFS_Charge_Transaction.ASYNC_REQUEST_IDENTIFIER.

      • holdReason

        public java.lang.String holdReason
        If rule 'Use Deprecated hold Functionality' is set, HoldReason will be set on the Order if holdOrderAndRaiseEvent is set to true. If rule is not set, HoldReason will be treated as HoldType. Order hold type will be added for the passed HoldReason, EnterpriseCode and DocumentType combination. Error is thrown if Hold type does not exist for the combination. Task queue records will be updated for hold type changes. HoldFlag is set to "Y" on order in any case.

      • suspendPayment

        public java.lang.String suspendPayment
        Suppose the order payment status is to be set as "FAILED_AUTH" or ""FAILED_CHARGE". Then if the payment method is to be suspended, set suspendPayment=Y (to suspend it only for charge) or to B (to suspend it for both charge and refund); the AuthorizationExpirationDate on the order will be set to current date. Otherwise, the AuthorizationExpirationDate on the order will remain HighDate so that requestCollection will not pick up this order for processing.

      • suspendExpAuthReversal

        public java.lang.String suspendExpAuthReversal
        If the payment method is suspended and if suspendExpAuthReversal=Y, then the authorization reversal are not created even though Authorization Reversal Strategy is configured for the payment type. Please note the flag comes into action only when SuspendAnyMoreCharges is either set to Y or B. Valid Values are N or Y (Null value behaves similar to setting it to N ). Please note all the authorization for a suspended payment method are considered expired as these will be marked unusable.

      • paymentMethodReasonCode

        public java.lang.String paymentMethodReasonCode
        Payment reasonCode. Used to overwrite the Reason code for last update on the payment method.

      • chargeTransactionReasonCode

        public java.lang.String chargeTransactionReasonCode
        Charge Transaction reasonCode. Store reason code for transaction update.

      • SvcNo

        public java.lang.String SvcNo
        Stored value card number. Used to overwrite the existing value on the payment method. Applicable only for payment methods without any other charge transaction records and is in payment type group STORED_VALUE_CARD or OTHERS.

      • DisplaySvcNo

        public java.lang.String DisplaySvcNo
        The four digits of the stored value card that should be displayed. Used to overwrite the existing value on the payment method only if SvcNo is also returned. Applicable only for payment methods without any other charge transaction records and is in payment type group STORED_VALUE_CARD or OTHERS.

      • PaymentReference1

        public java.lang.String PaymentReference1
        Payment reference 1. Used to overwrite the existing value on the payment method. Applicable only for payment methods without any other charge transaction records and is in payment type group STORED_VALUE_CARD or OTHERS.

      • DisplayPaymentReference1

        public java.lang.String DisplayPaymentReference1
        The four digits of payment reference 1 that should be displayed. Used to overwrite the existing value on the payment method only if PaymentReference1 is also returned. Applicable only for payment methods without any other charge transaction records and is in payment type group STORED_VALUE_CARD or OTHERS.

      • PaymentReference2

        public java.lang.String PaymentReference2
        Payment reference 2. Used to overwrite the existing value on the payment method. Applicable only for payment methods without any other charge transaction records and is in payment type group STORED_VALUE_CARD or OTHERS.

      • PaymentReference3

        public java.lang.String PaymentReference3
        Payment reference 3. Used to overwrite the existing value on the payment method. Applicable only for payment methods without any other charge transaction records and is in payment type group STORED_VALUE_CARD or OTHERS.

      • PaymentReference4

        public java.lang.String PaymentReference4
        Payment reference 4. Used to overwrite the existing value on the payment method.

      • PaymentReference5

        public java.lang.String PaymentReference5
        Payment reference 5. Used to overwrite the existing value on the payment method.

        public java.lang.String PaymentReference6
        Payment reference 6. Used to overwrite the existing value on the payment method.

        Payment reference 8. Used to overwrite the existing value on the payment method.

        Payment reference 9. Used to overwrite the existing value on the payment method.

      • eleExtendedFields

        public org.w3c.dom.Document eleExtendedFields
        If YFS_Payment table is extended, then the extended fields are passed as attributes in eleExtendedFields. The XML in this field will be like <PaymentMethod><Extn Extn1=" "/></PaymentMethod>, where Extn1 is an extended column.

      • RequiresCallForAuthorization

        public boolean RequiresCallForAuthorization
        Requires Call For Authorization. Indicates whether or not the authorization for this charge transaction should be obtained through a phone call. If true set to "Y" if false set to "N".

      • ConditionalCallForAuthorization

        public java.lang.String ConditionalCallForAuthorization
        ConditionalCallForAuthorization. Indicates whether or not this authorization, if it triggers a violation for going over the total offline amount permissible, can then require a call for an authorization code to allow the order to proceed. It should be returned as Y if the offline limit should trigger a call for auth. Returning RequiresCallForAuthorization will override this.

      • OfflineStatus

        public boolean OfflineStatus
        Offline Status. Indicates indicates the transaction attempted to reach the payment gateway within a UserExit, but the UserExit was unable to contact the gateway. If true set to "Y". Once payment gateway is reached from user exit, this may be updated to N and eventually reset to null.

      • recordAdditionalTransactions

        public org.w3c.dom.Document recordAdditionalTransactions

        If returned, this document will be used as the input document to recordExternalCharges, with some restrictions:

        • If passed, the Memo element will be removed
        • If passed, order information (for example, OrderHeaderKey or OrderNo) will be removed from the RecordExternalCharges element and will be replaced with the OrderHeaderKey passed in the input struct.
        • Any attribute passed in the PaymentMethod element will be removed and replaced with the PaymentKey for the payment that was passed in the input struct.

        This field is ignored by executePaymentTransactions and is not supported for CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT payment types.

      • PaymentTransactionError

        public org.w3c.dom.Document PaymentTransactionError
        Payment Transaction Error. This is a document type attribute that contains a list of payment transactions Errors.
        <PaymentTransactionErrorList>
          <PaymentTransactionError MessageType="" Message=""/>
        </PaymentTransactionErrorList>

      • bRetryVoidAsRefund

        public boolean bRetryVoidAsRefund
        Flag to indicate that the Void operation is not possible anymore and the transaction should be retried as Refund.

      • HoldAgainstBook

        public java.lang.String HoldAgainstBook
        Hold Against Book. This flag indicates whether or not pre-authorized or pre-charged amounts for the entire order will be held until the order is completely invoiced. If passed as 'Y', they will be. If passed as 'N', or not passed, the extra charge or authorization amount is not held. For example, if there are two units of $5 each on an pre-paid order, and $10 are collected up front, then when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund for $5 is created upon invoicing of the first unit. When passed as 'Y', no refund is created. If the pre-charged amount is $12 for the order, and when HoldRefundAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund is created for $7 upon invoicing of the first unit, and for $2 when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'Y'.

      • bChargeMayHaveOccurred

        public boolean bChargeMayHaveOccurred
        Charge May Have Occurred. This flag indicates that the communication with the Payment Gateway/Bank broke down at a point where it is not known whether the bank successfully processed the Charge or not. This flag handles a special case of offline payments scenario. This flag indicates that the payment status is still offline but the charge may have occurred and its status is unknown. This should be passed as true only when offline flag is passed as true. When this flag is passed as false, it means that the PaymentGateway/Bank could be not contacted i.e the charge never occurred, payment method was not charged, and it can be safely re processed or voided based on offline limit validations. When this flag is passed as true, it means that the PaymentGateway/Bank may have been contacted but no successful response received i.e. here the charge may have occurred but the information is not available, and if the charge did occur, we will need to create a void(reversal)request for this charge if offline limit validations fail. If this flag is passed as true, the UserExit status of Charge Transaction will remain in INVOKED status and to process these Charge Transactions further, YFSValidateInvokedCollectionUE user exit must be implemented.

      • linkRefundToSettlements

        public org.w3c.dom.Document linkRefundToSettlements
        Customer can override the recommended refund to settlements mapping while processing the refund settlement. If the mapping was not overridden please do not pass the attribute "linkRefundToSettlements" in the output. If the mapping is overridden then the attribute "linkRefundToSettlements" should be passed with the updated mapping, and the passed document will be persisted in the table "yfs_link_refund_to_settlement" with column "Overridden = Y". If the mapping is overridden then the existing mappings for the remaining refund-settlements agains the payment method will be processed again. Below is the refund to settlement xml document...
        <Recommended_LinkedSettlementList>
          <LinkedSettlement SettlementChargeTransactionKey="" TotalSettlementAmount="" UsedSettlementAmount="" SettlementOrderHeaderKey="" SettlementPaymentKey=""/>
        </Recommended_LinkedSettlementList>
